# CFArrayCopyDescriptionCallBack

**Type Alias**

Prototype of a callback function used to get a description of a value in an array.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias CFArrayCopyDescriptionCallBack = (UnsafeRawPointer?) -> Unmanaged<CFString>?
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The value to be described.

## Return Value

A textual description of `value`. The caller is responsible for releasing this object.

## Discussion

This callback is passed to [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFArrayCreate(_:_:_:_:)] in a [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFArrayCallBacks] structure. This callback is used by the [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFCopyDescription(_:)] function.

## Callbacks

- **CFArrayApplierFunction**: Prototype of a callback function that may be applied to every value in an array.
- **CFArrayEqualCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to determine if two values in an array are equal.
- **CFArrayReleaseCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to release a value before it’s removed from an array.
- **CFArrayRetainCallBack**: Prototype of a callback function used to retain a value being added to an array.
